metadata.name: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Run Keys Using Reg.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('reg')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' add ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('software\\\\microsoft\\\\windows\\\\currentversion\\\\run')))

output.summary: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate software automatically (mostly, during installation) sets up autorun keys for legitimate reasons. 2. Legitimate administrator sets up autorun keys for legitimate reasons. 3.
